sentences.english: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
sentences.chinese: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。

sentences.english: a cookery book
Have you booked a holiday this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？

detailed_translations.english: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them
to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.english: a 12-inch ruler

detailed_translations.chinese: 尺；统治者；[测] 划线板，划线的人
detailed_translations.english: someone such as a king or queen who has official power over a country or area

sentences.english: a sharp pencil
a blue pencil
a pencil sketch

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that you use for writing or drawing, consisting of a wooden stick with a thin piece of a black or coloured substance in the middle
to write something or make a mark with a pencil

sentences.english: She ran back to the classroom to get her schoolbag.
I was straightening my schoolbag when you phoned me.
sentences.chinese: 你给我打电话时，我正在整理书包。

sentences.english: Mom, could you buy me a new green leather schoolbag?
sentences.chinese: 妈妈，你能为我买一个新的绿色皮书包吗？

detailed_translations.english: A schoolbag is a bag that children use to carry books and other things to and from school

sentences.english: a primary school teacher

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to teach, especially in a school

sentences.english: I moved to this city six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前我搬到了这个城市。

sentences.english: I’m not late again, am I?
My husband and I enjoy going to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫喜欢去剧院看戏。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself

sentences.english: Our guests have arrived.
Has anyone phoned?
We’ve been spending too much money.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经花掉太多钱了。

sentences.english: I hadn’t seen him for 15 years.
‘I hope you’ve read the instructions.’ ‘Yes, of course I have.’
sentences.chinese: “我希望你已经看过使用说明了。”“当然看过了。”

sentences.english: You haven’t done much, have you?
They used to have a Mercedes Benz.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾经拥有一辆奔驰汽车。

sentences.english: She sat down and had another drink.

detailed_translations.chinese: （与过去分词连用构成完成时）
detailed_translations.english: used with past participles to form perfect tenses
used to say that someone owns something or that it is available for them to use

sentences.english: She had a beautiful face.
Her face was white with fear.
A big smile spread across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸上绽开了灿烂笑容。

sentences.english: I felt like punching him in the face.
sentences.chinese: 我真想给他脸上来一拳。

sentences.english: The birds build their nests in the rock face.

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are

sentences.english: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

detailed_translations.english: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

sentences.english: He’s got beautiful eyes.
There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.chinese: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.english: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.chinese: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

sentences.english: Someone punched him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

sentences.english: The table’s about this high and this wide.
sentences.chinese: 那桌子大约有这么高，这么宽。

sentences.english: You need to cut about this much off the end of the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 你要从管子头上切下大约这么多。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how big, how much etc, when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands

sentences.english: This is what we support.
I agree that she is the ablest of us.
sentences.chinese: 我承认她是我们之中最能干的一个。

sentences.english: This is all I have.
All my friends do not smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友并不全都吸烟。

sentences.english: Then you must be my cousin.
sentences.chinese: 那么你一定是我的远亲了。

sentences.english: I could hear a dog barking .
He’s taken the dog for a walk .
We used to have a dog when I was young.
the most popular breed of dog

detailed_translations.english: a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.

sentences.english: wild birds
The dawn was filled with the sound of birds.
sentences.chinese: 黎明时分，鸟鸣声不绝于耳。

sentences.english: a flock of birds
a wooden bird cage

detailed_translations.english: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs

sentences.english: He came at me like a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 他像老虎一般地向我冲过来。

sentences.english: Or tiger ?

detailed_translations.english: a large wild animal that has yellow and black lines on its body and is a member of the cat family

sentences.english: The monkey is beating up and down.
The monkey engulfed the food whole.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子囫囵吞下食物。

sentences.english: The monkey had deflowered an entire section of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子把花园中一整块地方的花都糟蹋了。

detailed_translations.english: a small brown animal with a long tail, which uses its hands to climb trees and lives in hot countries

sentences.english: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.
sentences.chinese: 警方跟他玩了一场精心布局的猫捉老鼠游戏，诱他落网。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with four legs that people often keep as a pet

sentences.english: Show me what you bought.
What he did was morally wrong.

detailed_translations.english: the thing which

sentences.english: ‘Where’s your office?’ ‘It’s on the third floor.’
I love the spring – it’s a wonderful time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢春季——这是一年里最美妙的时节。

sentences.english: There were people crying, buildings on fire. It was terrible!
sentences.chinese: 有人在哭喊，楼房在燃烧―太可怕了！

sentences.english: Don’t blame me. It wasn’t my idea.
sentences.chinese: 不要责备我，这不是我的主意。

sentences.english: This little beast is a lemur and it lives in Madagascar.
sentences.chinese: 这小动物是狐猴，生活在马达加斯加。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a thing, animal, situation, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about

sentences.english: They had one daughter.
one hundred and twenty-one pounds
Come back at one (= one o’clock ).
Katie’s almost one (= one year old ).
The children seemed upset. One was crying.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子好像不开心，有一个在哭。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1
used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things

sentences.english: I’d like you to line up in twos, please.
sentences.chinese: 请你们两个一组排好队。

detailed_translations.english: in groups of two people or things
the number 2

sentences.english: They’ve won their last three games.
sentences.chinese: 他们赢了最近三场比赛。

sentences.english: We’d better go. It’s almost three (= three o’clock ) .
My little sister’s only three (= three years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 3
the number 3

sentences.english: She is married with four children.
They arrived just after four (= four o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 刚过四点钟，他们就到了。

sentences.english: Luke will soon be four (= four years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 4

sentences.english: There is also a golf course five miles away.
sentences.chinese: 五英里外还有个高尔夫球场。

sentences.english: I’ll be back by five (= five o’clock ) .
The family moved to Canada when he was five (= five years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 他五岁时全家移居加拿大。

detailed_translations.english: the number 5

sentences.english: six months ago
She arrived just after six (= six o’clock ) .
He learnt to play the violin when he was six (= six years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 6
the number 6

sentences.english: The women visited cities in seven states.
sentences.chinese: 这些女性访问了七个州的城市。

sentences.english: We close the store at seven (= seven o’clock ) .
‘How old’s Sam?’ ‘He’s seven (= seven years old ) .’

detailed_translations.english: the number 7
the number 7

sentences.english: It’s only eight days till Christmas.
They woke at eight (= eight o’clock ).
My parents died when I was eight (= eight years old ).

detailed_translations.english: the number 8

sentences.english: He’s only been in this job for nine months.
sentences.chinese: 他干这份工作才九个月。

sentences.english: We open at nine (= nine o’clock ).
Kay was taught by her mother till she was nine (= nine years old ).
sentences.chinese: 凯一直由她妈妈教到九岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 9

sentences.english: Snow had been falling steadily for ten days.
I need to be home by ten (= ten o’clock ) .
At the time, she was about ten (= ten years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 10

sentences.english: How do you spell your name?
How can I help you?
I’d like to help in some way, but I’m not sure how.
sentences.chinese: 我想帮点忙，可不知道该怎么做。

sentences.english: He explained how the system worked.
sentences.chinese: 他讲解了该系统是如何运转的。

sentences.english: We both used to work at the airport – that’s how we met.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都曾经在机场工作过，我们就是这么认识的。

sentences.english: advice on how best (= the best way ) to invest your money
sentences.chinese: 如何以最好方式进行投资的建议

sentences.english: They had a number of suggestions as to how the service could be improved.
sentences.chinese: 他们有一些关于如何改进服务的建议。

sentences.english: This still leaves the question of how local services should be funded.
sentences.chinese: 这仍然没有解决如何为地方公共服务业提供资金的问题。

sentences.english: How many kids do they have now?

detailed_translations.english: used to ask or talk about the way in which something happens or is done

sentences.english: Among his many hobbies was the breeding of fine horses.
sentences.chinese: 在他的众多爱好中有饲养名马。

sentences.english: The printing press gave power to a few to change the world for the many.
sentences.chinese: 印刷机赋予了少数人为多数人改变世界的力量。

sentences.english: Not many expected Ferdinand to be such a success this season.
sentences.chinese: 预料到费迪南德在本赛季如此成功的人并不多。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of people or things
many people

sentences.english: They  are my students.
We are sure you dare not.
sentences.chinese: 我们断定你们是不敢的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 是（be的第二人称单复数现在式）

detailed_translations.english: a unit of area equal to 100 sq metres or 119.599 sq yards; one hundredth of a hectare

sentences.english: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以回到我的小屋去吃午饭。

sentences.english: Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰？我一直想去那儿。

sentences.english: Hold it right there and don’t move.
Can you pass me that wine glass there?
sentences.chinese: 你能把那个葡萄酒杯递给我吗？

sentences.english: Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.
sentences.chinese: 看，那就是我跟你说过的那家书店。

sentences.english: Who’s that man over there ?
It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.
Are we going to get there (= arrive ) before the banks close?
sentences.chinese: 银行关门之前，我们到得了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 在那里；在那边；在那点上
detailed_translations.english: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do

sentences.english: a black evening dress
It was still pitch black (= very dark ) out.

detailed_translations.english: having the darkest colour, like coal or night

sentences.english: yellow flowers

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
to become yellow or make something become yellow

sentences.english: the blue waters of the lake
She nearly always dresses in blue.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎总是穿蓝色的衣服。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day
the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day

sentences.english: We painted the door bright red .
a red balloon
I like the way the artist uses red in this painting.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢画家在这幅作品中对红色的运用。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of blood
the colour of blood

sentences.english: beautiful green eyes
Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
a room decorated in pale blues and greens
sentences.chinese: 用浅蓝色和浅绿色装修的房间

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of grass or leaves
the colour of grass and leaves

sentences.english: Her eyes suddenly met his and she coloured slightly.
sentences.chinese: 她的目光突然和他相遇，她微微有点脸红了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…涂颜色，粉饰；歪曲；使脸红
detailed_translations.english: when someone colours, their face becomes redder because they are embarrassed

detailed_translations.chinese: 颜色；风格；气色，面色；外貌
detailed_translations.english: red, blue, yellow, green, brown, purple etc

sentences.english: apple pie
an apple tree
roast pork and apple sauce (=  a thick sauce made from cooked apples  )

detailed_translations.english: a hard round fruit that has red, light green, or yellow skin and is white inside

sentences.english: Pick an orange, pick a pear.
sentences.chinese: 摘一个橙子，摘一个梨子。

sentences.english: I took this apple for a pear until I tasted it.
sentences.chinese: 我误将这个苹果当作梨子，直到我尝了才知道。

sentences.english: Is it a pear?

detailed_translations.english: a sweet juicy fruit that has a round base and is thinner near the top, or the tree that produces this fruit

sentences.english: The area is under banana cultivation.
The banana bears two crops every year.
He told me that the palm of banana hefted 5 pounds.
sentences.chinese: 他说那把香蕉称重为5磅。

detailed_translations.english: a long curved tropical fruit with a yellow skin

sentences.english: orange juice
orange peel
Peel the oranges and divide them into segments.
sentences.chinese: 把橙子去皮，然后切成片。

sentences.english: orange groves (= where orange trees grow )

detailed_translations.english: a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside

sentences.english: ‘Will Kay come?’ ‘She may do.’
So now you know as much as I do.
sentences.chinese: 那么现在你知道的和我一样多了。

sentences.english: ‘You forgot all about it.’ ‘No, I didn’t.’
sentences.chinese: “你把这事忘记得一干二净。” “没有，我没忘记。”

sentences.english: ‘I want to go home.’ ‘So do I.’
I didn’t believe the story and neither did he.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信这个故事，他也不信。

detailed_translations.english: used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used
used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used

sentences.english: Hi, Kelly. How are you?
You must all listen carefully.
sentences.chinese: 你们大家都必须仔细听着。

sentences.english: I have some news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些消息要告诉你们。

sentences.english: The letter is addressed to both of you.
Did Robin give you the money?
Only you can make this decision.
sentences.chinese: 只有你才能作这个决定。

sentences.english: You idiot!
You boys have got to learn to behave yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 你们这些男孩子必须学着规矩点。

sentences.english: Hey, you over there! Get out of the way!

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a person or group of people when speaking or writing to them

detailed_translations.chinese: (You)人名；(柬)尤；(东南亚国家华语)猷

sentences.english: I like your jacket.
I don’t really like classical music.
sentences.chinese: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。

sentences.english: Do you like this colour?
I like my coffee quite weak.
I don’t like it when you get angry.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。

sentences.english: How do you like living in London (= how much do you like it )?
I quite like their new album.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。

sentences.english: We really liked the film.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。

sentences.english: The time I like best (= like most of all ) is the evening when it’s cool.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。

sentences.english: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.
Would you like a drink?

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good

sentences.english: ‘Would you like a sandwich?’ ‘Yes, please.’
sentences.chinese: “你想来个三明治吗？”“好的，谢谢。”

sentences.english: ‘Would you like to come with us?’ ‘Yes, I’d love to.’
sentences.chinese: “你想和我们一起去吗？”“好的，我很乐意。”

detailed_translations.english: used as an answer to say that you want something or want to do something

sentences.english: ‘Are you Italian?’ ‘No, I’m Spanish.’
sentences.chinese: “你是意大利人吗？”“不，我是西班牙人。”

sentences.english: ‘Do you want any more?’ ‘No thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “你还要再来点吗？”“不要了，谢谢。”

sentences.english: ‘Could you help me write this?’ ‘No, sorry, I haven’t got time at the moment.’
sentences.chinese: “你能帮我写这个吗？”“抱歉，不行，我现在没时间。”

sentences.english: He wanted to take me to a disco but I said no.
sentences.chinese: 他想带我去迪斯科舞厅，但是我拒绝了。

sentences.english: Sixty percent of people voted no.
If you’re asking whether I feel the same way about her, the answer is no.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问的是我对她是否也有相同的感觉，答案是没有。

detailed_translations.english: used to give a negative reply to a question, offer, or request
